question: Given the same probabilities \( p = 0.6 \) and \( q = 0.4 \), calculate the probability of being in state \( S_2 \) after 4 tosses, using the initial conditions \( S_1(1) = q \), \( S_2(1) = p \), and \( S_3(1) = 0 \).
solution:
To find \( S_2(4) \), we will use the difference equations:

1. \( S_2(n) = p S_1(n-1) \)

We already calculated \( S_1(3) \):

- \( S_1(3) = 0.256 \)

Now we calculate \( S_2(4) \):

\[
S_2(4) = p S_1(3) = 0.6 \cdot 0.256 = 0.1536
\]

Thus, the probability of being in state \( S_2 \) after 4 tosses is:

\[
\boxed{0.1536}
\]
